statement.p: There are 84 first-graders at Bonnair Elementary School. What fraction of the first-graders have been immunized against German measles?
One hundred thirty-eight of the employees at Digitronics enrolled in a bonus incentive plan. What fraction of the employees enrolled?
Gladys filled her car with gas three times while driving to Yellowstone National Park, a distance of 480 miles. What was her car's fuel efficiency during the trip?

li.p: g: gallons of gas Gladys' car holds

statement.p: Write a fraction that gives the length of a rectangle in terms of its area and its width.

Sharelle's car still had 4 gallons in the gas tank when she filled up for $18.
If the gas tank holds x gallons, what was the price per gallon of the gasoline?
Evaluate your fraction for x=14. What does your answer mean in this context?

li.p: 1.8; If the tank holds 14 gallons, gas costs $1.80 per gallon.

statement.p:
Morgan drove across country in h hours, but he estimates that he spent 10 hours stopped for rest and meals.
If he drove a total of 2800 miles, what was his average speed on the road?
Evaluate your fraction forh=50. What does your answer mean in this context?

The volume of a test tube is given by its height times the area of its cross-section. A test tube that holds 200 cubic centimeters is 2x-1 centimeters long.
What is the area of its cross-section?
Evaluate your fraction for x=13. What does your answer mean in the context of the problem?

li.p: 8; If x=13, the area of the cross-section is 8 \text{cm}^2.
